Stiff person syndrome is a phenomenon in which you develop a set of beliefs that seem fixed from your childhood, beliefs that are not only true but are actually self-sabotaging. To explain what this is, let's say that you grew up in a small town populated by a very tight-knit family.
a man talking about human relationships. Humans spend most of their lives with close friends, family, neighbors, and those they see for the first time everyday. They rarely talk to strangers.
